newsitem.title: FRANCE: Credit National turns H1 net attrib loss.
newsitem.headline: Credit National turns H1 net attrib loss.

text.p: (Figures in millions of French francs unless stated)

NOTE - Credit National said in its results statement that the 1995 figures were pro-forma and the first-half provision of 250 million francs is part of a total restructuring provision of 500 million francs.

A poll of analysts conducted by Reuters at the start of the first-half results season produced an average forecast of 260 million francs, with the highest forecast at 300 million and the lowest at 150 million.
The statement said there would have been net attributable profit of around 100 million francs if restructuring charges had not been included.

The restructuring principally concerns staff levels after the acquisition of BFCE bank, Credit National said. A "staff excess" of about 600, mainly due to overlap, was expected by 1998 and talks were underway with staff representatives on the measures that would be taken, it added in its statement.
